Class Date

java.lang.Object
Date
public class Date
extends java.lang.Object
The Date class handles the creation of Date objects and provides all values for said objects. Additionally, it holds the method, isValid(), which verifies the validity of a date represented by the Date object. Also, it holds a testbed main method to test a set of testcases to confirm the competency of isValid().
Author:
Anuraj Dubey, Chenghao Lin

    • Date

      public Date​(java.lang.String date)
      This method creates a Date object by using an input of a String (date) of the format mm/dd/yyyy.
      Parameters:
      date - in MM/DD/YYYY format to be tokenized

    • Date

      public Date()
      This method creates an object of the current date today.

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      This method checks a Date object, and confirms if it is indeed a valid date of publishment, based on sensible criteria.
      Returns:
      True if the date is valid, or false if the date is invalid.

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Parameters:
      args - This is a main method, which is used to execute a given set of Date testcases in order to test the validity of these Dates.
